p: M. officinalis exhibit antiviral effects against Newcastle disease virus, Semliki forest virus, influenza virus, myxoviruses, vaccinia [ 240], and herpes simplex virus types 1 and 2 [ 241], HIV-1 [ 242]. The antiviral effects are mediated by tannin and polyphenol constituents, rosmarinic, caffeic, and ferulic acids [ 240].
